choices.C: Streams are intended to modify the source data.
choices.A: A stream cannot be consumed more than once.
choices.D: A parallel stream is always faster than an equivalent sequential stream.
choices.B: The execution mode of streams can be changed during processing.
choices.E: Stream operation accepts lambda expressions as its parameters.

discussion.content: Answer is A

The correct answers are A and E:

A: A stream cannot be consumed more than once.
E: Stream operations accept lambda expressions as their parameters.
A is the answer

Selected Answer: A
A is true as exception is thrown if same stream is used after terminal operation is run on it.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is letter A, a stream can only be consumed once. Regarding the letter E, it is false, pay attention that the statement talks about the stream parameter and not the method parameter, you cannot use a lambda expression as a stream parameter, it is a trick.

Selected Answer: A
A & E are correct!

comments.content: No, the "peek()" method is an intermediate operation

discussion.content:
A is NOT. Can use peak() consumed more than one.
Answer is B. Because can change parallel stream to change mode.

Selected Answer: A
After the terminal operation is performed, the stream pipeline is considered consumed, and can no longer be used.

For Intermediate operations,they always return a new stream
stream takes no parameter, so E is incorrect.
A and E are correct.
Is E correct?
Answer is A

questions.question_text: Which two reasons should you use interfaces instead of abstract classes? (Choose two.)

choices.C: You want to share code among several closely related classes.
choices.D: You want to declare non-static on non-final fields.
choices.A: You expect that classes that implement your interfaces have many common methods or fields, or require access modifiers other than public.
choices.E: You want to take advantage of multiple inheritance of type.
choices.B: You expect that unrelated classes would implement your interfaces.

discussion.content:
B,E
(B: the relationship between the interface itself and the class implementing the interface is not necessarily strong)
B,E is the correct.

Selected Answer: BE
B and E are correct.

answers are 
B,E
answer is B, E
Interface only support public access modifier so A is not correct

questions.question_text:

Path file = Paths.get ("courses.txt");
// line n1
courses.txt is accessible.

Assume the -
line n1 to enable the code to print the content of the courses.txt file?
Which code fragment can be inserted at

discussion.content:
Files.readAllLines returns a list of strings.
the correct answer is C

Selected Answer: C
C is correct since readAllLines returns List rather than Stream. For this to be true assume that Files is static imported and there is no need for it to be present in front of readAllLines.

Selected Answer: C
Files.readAllLines returns a list of strings. The correct answer is C

Answer is B.
Option D is incorrect because it can't print courses.txt, must add fc.forEach(System.out::print).
B is incorrect because Files.readAllLines(file) return a list of strings not a Stream

D is correct with this addition :
fc.forEach(n -> System.out.println(n));
The correct answer is D

C can be the answer with below modification.
Stream<String> fc = Files.readAllLines (file).stream();
